Class ConsoleIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • ConsoleIO
  • public class ConsoleIO
extends java.lang.Object
    Deals with IO related to the user via the console.

    • Method Detail

      • GetInput

        public java.lang.String GetInput()
                          throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Waits for reader to be ready, then reads input. Getting an input via this method allows the thread to be interrupted.
        Returns:
        The given input.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If any thread has interrupted the current thread. The interrupted status of the current thread is cleared when this exception is thrown.
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

      • StopInputs

        public void StopInputs()
        Immediately stops any blocking calls waiting for a user input. To have any affect this must be called from a thread other than the one being blocked.

      • Log

        public static void Log​(java.lang.String str,
                       java.lang.Object... args)
        Logs a string to the console.
        Parameters:
        str - A format string.
        args - Arguments reference in the format string.

      • LogError

        public static void LogError​(java.lang.String str,
                            java.lang.Object... args)
        Logs an error in the console.
        Parameters:
        str - A format string.
        args - Arguments reference in the format string.

      • LogHighlight

        public static void LogHighlight​(java.lang.String str,
                                java.lang.Object... args)
        Logs a string to console in a highlighted colour, making it easier to differentiate from other logs.
        Parameters:
        str - A format string.
        args - Arguments reference in the format string.
